AAL90.name: Automated Anatomical Labeling (AAL) 90
AAL90.description: Classic anatomical atlas based on single-subject MNI template with 90 cortical and subcortical regions
AAL90.notes: One of the most widely used atlases in neuroimaging. Good for hypothesis-driven ROI analyses.

HCP_MMP_GLASSER_360.name: Human Connectome Project Multi-Modal Parcellation (HCP-MMP1.0)
HCP_MMP_GLASSER_360.description: High-resolution cortical parcellation based on multiple MRI modalities (architecture, function, connectivity, topography)
HCP_MMP_GLASSER_360.notes: Highly parcellated atlas ideal for detailed cortical analysis. May not generalize well to older populations or children. Does not include subcortical structures.

BRAINNETOME.name: Brainnetome Atlas
BRAINNETOME.description: In vivo atlas based on connectivity patterns, subdividing AAL regions into finer functional subregions
BRAINNETOME.notes: Provides functionally meaningful subdivisions based on connectivity patterns. Good balance between detail and interpretability.

GORDON333.name: Gordon Surface-based Parcellation
GORDON333.description: Surface-based functional parcellation derived from resting-state fMRI data
GORDON333.notes: Functional parcellation based on task-free fMRI. Good for network-based analyses across the lifespan.

POWER264.name: Power Functional ROIs
POWER264.description: Functional ROIs based on meta-analysis of task fMRI and resting-state connectivity
POWER264.notes: Widely used for graph-theoretical analysis and network neuroscience. Includes both cortical and subcortical regions.

DOSENBACH160.name: Dosenbach Functional ROIs
DOSENBACH160.description: Functional ROIs identified from task and rest fMRI, emphasizing control and sensorimotor networks
DOSENBACH160.notes: Particularly useful for developmental and lifespan studies. Emphasizes control networks.

CRADDOCK200.name: Craddock 200 Parcellation
CRADDOCK200.description: Spatially constrained spectral clustering parcellation based on resting-state fMRI
CRADDOCK200.notes: Data-driven parcellation providing good balance between spatial specificity and functional coherence.

DESTRIEUX.name: Destrieux Atlas
DESTRIEUX.description: Surface-based cortical parcellation with detailed gyral and sulcal labeling
DESTRIEUX.notes: Based on FreeSurfer surface parcellation. More detailed than Desikan-Killiany. Cortical regions only.

DESTRIEUX_SCGM.name: Destrieux Atlas with Subcortical Gray Matter
DESTRIEUX_SCGM.description: Destrieux cortical atlas extended with subcortical gray matter structures
DESTRIEUX_SCGM.notes: Extended version of Destrieux atlas including subcortical structures (thalamus, caudate, putamen, etc.)

DK_SCGM82.name: Desikan-Killiany Atlas with Subcortical (82 ROIs)
DK_SCGM82.description: Desikan-Killiany cortical parcellation with subcortical gray matter structures
DK_SCGM82.notes: Default FreeSurfer cortical parcellation plus subcortical structures. Widely used in clinical neuroimaging.

metadata.attribution: Atlas coordinate files obtained using the BrainGraph R package (Watson, 2024)
metadata.brainGraph_reference: Watson CG (2024). brainGraph: Graph Theory Analysis of Brain MRI Data. R package version 3.1.0
metadata.file_format: CSV with MNI coordinates and region metadata
metadata.notes: NIfTI atlas images to be added in future releases. Current CSV files contain ROI coordinates, labels, and metadata suitable for network analysis and visualization.

anatomical.description: Based on anatomical landmarks and structural features

functional.description: Based on functional connectivity patterns from fMRI

multimodal.description: Based on multiple imaging modalities (structure, function, connectivity)

connectivity-based.description: Based on white matter connectivity or resting-state connectivity patterns
